thread.title: Former teammates congratulate Robbie Gould on record setting kick
thread.title_full: Former teammates congratulate Robbie Gould on record setting kick | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: Former teammates congratulate Robbie Gould on record setting kick
text:
When fans think about the greatest players in Chicago Bears history, names like Payton, Butkus and Sayers come up. However, kicker Robbie Gould is now owns one of the most impressive team records.
With his second field goal of the game Sunday, Gould became the team’s all-time leading scorer.
Robbie Gould becomes Bears' all-time leader in points scored Gould now has 1,118 points, two points ahead of longtime kicker Kevin Butler. Walter Payton has the third most with 750.
Following the record breaking kick, a few former teammates reached out to Gould on Twitter to congratulate him.
@RobbieGould09 Salute!!! #Bears
— Jerry Azumah (@JerryAzumah) October 11, 2015
@RobbieGould09 Congrats on being the all-time scorer!!! That's big time
— Charles Tillman (@peanuttillman) October 11, 2015
Congrats to the all time leader in points of the @ChicagoBears !! Good job @RobbieGould09 !!
 #WeAre
 #BearDown
— ANTHONY ADAMS (@spiceadams) October 11, 2015
Even Butler, who played for the Bears from 1985 through the 1995 season, congratulated Gould.
Congrats @robbiegould09 to @chicagobears all time leading scorer! @nfl @espnnfl espn @ Soldier Field https://t.co/B5AgD27gPi
— Kevin Butler (@Therealbutthead) October 11, 2015
Gould was on pace to break the record last season, but a career low in points pushed the record breaking kick back a year.
The former Pro Bowl kicker is back on track this year. He’s a perfect 9-for-9 in field goals and has only missed one extra point on the year.
